ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Integrated Rural Technology Centre (IRTC) is a Research, Development and Extension centre, working with the objectives of developing and disseminating appropriate technologies for Sustainable Rural Development, creating employment and improving the quality of life of the rural people through application of science and technology. It was set up in 1987, by Kerala Sasthra Sahithya Parishad (KSSP),with the support from the Department of Science and Technology (DST), Govt. Of India and Kerala State Council for Science Technology Environment (KSCSTE), Government of Kerala. Presently IRTC is provided core support grant by DST, Govt.of India. During the last two and half decades, IRTC has taken up more than 150 research projects in diverse areas like energy, rural technology, education, health, environment, agriculture and allied areas, resource based local level planning and also imparting training in various livelihood support activities (soap making, mushroom cultivation, ceramic ornament making, mural work, decoupage etc). It has contact with almost all the R&D institutions in the state and many outside Kerala too. IRTC, through its mother organization KSSP,is also a part of the All India Peoples Science Network (AIPSN).More than 500 LSGIs in the State had availed the technical or consultancy support of IRTC for various sustainable development activities. IRTC has three categories of full time S&T personnel a) senior faculty, who are either retired from other services or on deputation b) middle level faculty, with experience and expertise in project/research management and c) junior staff fresh from colleges. Apart from these, there are subject experts/consultants who interact/contribute to the various S&T activities on a regular basis. IRTC campus is situated in a rural setting with cost effective constructions and simple community living. There are laboratories, field stations, experimental unit for energy, waste disposal, watershed programs, hostel facility for staff and students. It has a campus of about 3.54 hectares and 4620m2 of built up area including office block, civil engineering block Microbiology, chemistry & Environmental laboratories, Electronics lab, Soap production unit, Mushroom production center, Rabbit rearing unit, Mechanical workshop, Aqua culture lab and ponds, Mess hall & Kitchen, Library & Auditorium, air conditioned lecture/ seminar hall, IRTC is having a new Jubilee Campus, with facilities like an emporium, training and extension centre. Students from different disciplines were using our academic as well as physical facilities for doing their project work and internship. Further IRTC is an agency accredited by Govt. Of Kerala for the preparation of Panchayat level resource maps, power line mapping and in the implementation of watershed development, Rain Water harvesting, and solid waste management. Major Areas of Activties 1-ENERGY SECTOR a-Development of hot box b-Development of improved chulahs c-Small and mini hydel projects d-Energy Audit e-Installation of solar power plants f-Biomass gasifier 2-RURAL TECHNOLOGIES a-Soap mold making b-Handmade soaps and other toiletry items c-Value addition terracotta d-Fabrication of Electric potter wheel e-Fabrication of clay pugging machines f-Technology services to local bodies 3-NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT a-Panchayath resource mapping b-Watershed master plan preparation c-Digitization of spacial data(GIS) d-Roof water harvesting e-Watershed development 4-EXTENSION AND TRAINING a- Soap and toiletries b-Ornamental fish farming c-Decoupage d-Mushroom farming e-Micro-enterprises management 5-SANITATION AND SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT a-Vermi and windrow composting b-Toilet linked biogas plants c-Municipal solid waste management d-Construction of domestic and community level biogas plants e-Water quality analysis

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The Isa Viswa Prajnana Trust (IVPT) is a registered charity, founded by H.H. Swami Isa, which seeks to create a world in sustained balance through an inclusive vision of the individual, society, environment and world. IVPTâ€™s projects are based on Swami Isaâ€™s concept of â€œTotal Consciousness,â€ or total awareness, which is achieved through an integration of objective (outer) knowledge / activity with subjective (inner) knowledge / activity. The IVPT organizes the Global Energy Parliament, and runs a higher education institution (the Isa Universal Centre for Higher Studies), a school (the Isa Viswa Vidyalayam) and a research centre. IVPT conducts national and international seminars on Education, Science & Technology, Energy, Medicine, Economics, Peace, etc.; conducts international campaigns such as the Economic Literacy Campaign and Green Neighbourhood Project; holds regular discourses with the public and especially with women; conducts environmental and food security activities and environmental awareness programs; conducts camps and activities for children promoting human values; provides technical education to children and adults with disabilities; provides relief and services to disaster victims and low-income sectors of society; provides free medical services and healthcare to those in need; provides clothing and comfort to the elderly and abandoned; provides education for girls; conducts marriage and family counseling and seeks to eradicate the dowry system; holds awareness programmes for prevention of violence against women; holds regular lecture series on a variety of social and economic topics; publishes a variety of media to increase awareness in these areas; and organizes additional programs as necessary. The Global Energy Parliament (GEP) is the IVPTâ€™s primary international work. The GEP is an international body drawing from the worldâ€™s National Energy Parliaments, whose collective mission is to ensure a self-sustaining, peacefulÂ existence for human beings and the universe by: 1) providing scientific research, recommendations and strategies to develop human thought through a comprehensive understanding of the relationship between internal and external energy; 2) promote and develop scientific research on energy; 3) create legislation and problem-solving strategies based on the science of energy; 4) advance public awareness about energy balance, and programs to allow individuals to realize its benefits. The Global Energy Parliament Research Centre conducts ongoing research into affordable forms of renewable energy, total systems of education, holistic forms of law and justice, society and culture, and integrated medicine.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Activities of Islamic Educational movement at a glance Islamic Educational Movement (IEM), Feroke is one of the charitable organizations in Kerala which stands for educational uplift of backward community especially social and religious minority. The thrust areas of its activities are social service and running educational institutions. IEM has proved its metal as well equipped for handling all social reformation activities through last three decades of its historical voyage. Main Organs of IEM and its precise report 1. Educational institutions a. IEM pre-primary school b. IEM LP School c. IEM UP School d. NEST Public School e. Irshadiya Higher secondary school f. Irshadiya college of commerce and social sciences More than One thousand students have been studying under these institutions. Every institutions focus on overall development of pupils. Educational institutions specially pay attention to conduct various programmes in order to impart the secular notion and national integrity among the students. Observation of different nationally important days, sport and Arts competitions, visiting historic heritages etc are very some examples of our programmes. 2. Social Activities The organization is being considered as the forerunner of social activities in our locality and district. Some of flagship programmes are pinpointed below a. Housing projects : Being a very help to those vulnerable people from different community, the organization has crystallized more than 5 housing projects b. Drinking water projects: the organization has got immeasurable appreciation from different walks of people because of its attempt to provide drinking water for the society as whole. Digging wells where it is necessary, building up of huge water tank for storage, distribution of water at house door during dry season etc are the examples of its activities. c. Interest less micro finance: Not much elaborated but sufficient size amount is being spent for supporting self help groups. d. Conducting different workshops and seminar e. Scholarships: more than 120 students are getting scholarships from our organization yearly f. Women empowerment : it is the one of the key areas of attention of IEM leaders to facilitate the sources and means for motivating women folk through workshops, seminars and door to door campaigns g. Environment protection: we observe the national important days on environment protection, water and soil protection. For this purpose student cadets organize campaigns

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Specialised education integrated with values awareness. Socio- economic upliftment through literacy outreach. Vocational courses and allied programmes. Equivalency programmes through the Open Learning System. Imparting of occupational and technical knowledge. Training and orientation courses for key resourses persons. Enviormental Awareness. Promoting National goals of secularism, equality and integration. Jss,Idukki has given vocational training to 2300 beneficieries on an average every year, since its inception in the year 2003.The courses are aimed at illiterates, neoliterates and people below the poverty line.The courses range from candle making to computer hardware.Placement oriented courses like welding,plumbing, exlectrician,nursing assistant,pharmacy assistant etc have complete placement.Production oriented courses for house wives and women in the tribal belt range from pappads, pickles, mushrooms bamboo weaving etc.A trade mark brand name,"janasree"has been registered to promote theproducts made by the beneficieries of JSS Idukki.Exhibitons have been conducted in association with the Ministry of Textiles,and stalls are regularly put up at various melas.Courses are conducted in association with MSME, TRIFED, Mininstry of Textiles etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Jan Shikshan Sansthan Thrissur established in the year 2000 and achieved remarkable progress through its excellent service in providing literacy linked vocational training and awareness programmes to the needy deprived and under privileged sections of the society for augmenting their income and to provide academic and technical support to district literacy mission through continuing education centers in taking up vocational skill development programmes mainly for illiterates neo literates women SC ST communities minorities back ward classes and physically challenged. In addition to this JSS has been providing vocational skill development programmes to the needy in collaboration with kudumbasree SHGs panchayath raj instituions Government departments and other voluntary organizations. The vocational skill development programmes conducted by the JSS has benefited the participants to obtain wage employment self employment and facilitated to set up their own production units and service centers.Training programmes of JSS Thrissur has covered 46269 beneficiaries from 2000 onward. Jan Shikshan Sansthan has been conducting awareness programmes and activities in social economic and cultural fields. It is noteworthy to mention that the life enrichment education is a part and parcel of our vocational training programmes. A large number of the beneficiaries were linked to the centrally sponsored schemes such as Prime Ministers Jan Dhan Yojana Prime Ministers Sureksha Bhima Yojana Pradhan Manthri Mudra Yojana Sansaad Adharsh Gram Yojana.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Advanced training and practice of kathakali (cholliyattam), theatre practice and new theatre productions are being regularly carried out in this kalari. During a very short span of time, due to the dedicated, sincere and diversified activities, Janabheri today has grown to a very large extend. Famous institutions like Kerala Sangeetha Nataka Academy, Kerala Sahitya Academy, All Indian Radio Thrissur,Municipal corporation and Shornur Municipality have come forward to cooperate with the running and working of Janabheri. World famous kathakali artisans and theatre exponents had also extended sincere and dedicated cooperation for the success of Janabheri. It is a matter of great pride to say that Janabheri had opportunities to present kathakali performances in lot of important cities of the country including Bharat Bhavan in Bhopal. Over the years Janabheri was sincerely indulging in spreading the kathakali art form among the bulk of people who have only heard about such an art form and also ensured to make them realise that this is an art exclusively of their own, and this effort Janabheri had been successful beyond imagination. ngoList.title: JANARANJINI VAYANASALA
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: JANARANJINI VAYANASALA KOLANI.PO, THODUPUZHA. Reg. No: I â€“ 262 / 1990 & 06/TDA/0598 Introduction. Kolani Janaranjini Vayanasala is situated in a rural area of Thodupuzha Municipality, 2 Kms away from Thodupuzha town. The institution was got inaugurated on 11th February 1949 by Smt. J.Thankam, the then Organiser of Travancore Grandhasala Sanghom. Now this is the first in the district in collection of Books. The library was started at first in a building owned by NSS and now the library has two buildings having 240 Sq.meters and 60 Sq. meters in its own 10.2 cents of land. This institution had won the State level award, D C PURSKAR, of Kerala State Library Council for the best Rural Library in the year 2000. This institution has got the District Level award in the year 2008 from Nehru Yuva Kendra for the best Voluntary Organisation in the district. And also had won the District level award of Kerala State Library Council for the best Library in the year 2013-14. This institution had also won the State level award, I.V.DAS PURSKAR, of Kanoor District Library Council for the best Library in the year 2014. ACTIVITIES LIBRARY This institutions main activity is funtioning Library. This â€œAâ€ grade library have at present 30562 Nos. of books valued Rs. 12,64,119/- and 1649 members. And also Furniture and equipments valueing Rs. Rs. 5,91,566.80 in library stock. READING ROOM The existing reading room of this library is functioning from 6 am to 9 pm on all days. There are 9 Dailies, 9 weeklies, 4 employment news journals, 10 childrenâ€™s periodicals and more than 19 other periodicals are available here for the public. BALAVEDI - CHILDRENâ€™S LIBRARY Childrenâ€™s books and other publications are available in this section. A color T.V. has also provided to this section. There are 123 members and 9123 books are available in this section. WOMENS SECTION A well maintained womenâ€™s section is functioning with the assistance of Kerala State Library Council and they are conducting various programmes for the empowerment of women in every year. REFERENCE SECTION This division includes all kinds of books relating to various branches of knowledge. This section is being benefited to many students and job seeking youths as well as general public. ARTS & SPORTS CLUB A club named â€œRenjith Rural Recreation Clubâ€™â€™ is functioning under the control of the library. â€œSEVANAâ€™â€™ - THE RURAL INFORMATION CENTRE As part of a project of Kerala State Library Council, libraries functioning in rural areas have to be converted as â€œ The Rural Information Centreâ€™â€™ with the help of modern information technology. This library is also converted as a Rural Information Centre. All facilities of computer oriented technology including Internet Broad Band Connection have been provided in this centre to rural public. NEHRU YUVA KENDRA RURAL INFORMATION TECNOLOGY YOUTH DEVOLOPMENT CENTRE The NYK Youth Development Centre functioning in this library is upgraded to Rural Information Technology Youth Development Centre. NEHRU YUVA KENDRA VYPPTA INFORMATION CENTRE & RED RIBBON CLUB The NYK VYPPTA Information centre and Red Ribbon club functioning with the support of Thodupzha I.M.A. Blood Donors Forum is working along with this section. SCHOLARSHIP Every year give a Scholarship to the best student pass secondary examination with the help of Dwandwadari Vidyasala, Thodupuzha. VAYOMITRRAM A Govt. health project for senior citizens also working in the library building named Vayomitram. OTHER ITEMS Other important divisions functioning under this library are Gandhian Literature Wing, Agricultural Books Corner, Forestry Desk, Kudumbasree Ayalkootam, Dance class, Tution class, Musical instrument class etc. OTHER PROGRAMMES As part of this Library we are conducing Educational Programmes, Orientation Classes, Quiz and other Competitions for children etc.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Kripa Samithy is the registered under the Society of Ranni - Nilackel Diocese of Malankara Mar Thoma Syrian Church. Kripa Samithy Registered on 2nd December 1998 under Thiru-Kochi Charitable Society Act. It includes 10 types of different activity such as De-addiction, Old age home, Half way home Psychiatric Rehabilitation Centre, Rehabilitation Centre for Mentally Retired Adult People, Child Development Programme, Rural Development Programme.Navajeeva Kendram is a treatment and Rehabilitation Centre for Alcoholics and drug addicts. Navajeeva kendram is situated in Malayalapuzha Panchaythu of Pathanamthitta Dist. This institution is working based on the theme â€œLifted to liftâ€ and the vision is to â€œSave the Alcoholic, Save the family, Save the family, Save the Societyâ€It is a Psychiatric Rehabilitation centre340 patients were rehabilitated during past 13 years. 126 Patients were treated during the last years. 71 persons return to their homes after treatment. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Mainly working among sexual minorities and sex workers since inception. Working for social and cultural development. Working with them for their ecconomic, social and cultural development. Main areas of intervention include heatlh awareness, HIV/AIDS prevention, rehabilitaion of sex workers and their behavioural change through micro finance and SHGs etc. PROJECTS: Lasyakairali is an implementing agency of of Suraksha project funded by Kerala State AIDS Control Society(KSACS). Suraksha is a sexual health program of the Government of Kerala. Lasyakairali Ssuraksha project is working amoung Men who have sex with men (MSM) in the area. The area covered under this project includes Kottayam, Pala, Vaikom, Ettumanoor and Changanacherry of Kottayam District of Kerala. Other Programmes: Art &Culture: Another area of intervention is in ARTS and Culture. Conducting training in in Dance and dance performances. Running a Professional cultural troop also. Medical Aid: Providing medical and finacial support to its poor members who are in urgent need of medicine or health care. Financial Support: providinig financial support for marriage of children, their education of their members. Legal Support: Providing legal support for their memebrs for any legal issues.
